Name: Rim Commonality
Description: During the Jihad, the Rim Commonality declared independence from the League on the 13th of April 3075 The Rim Commonality cited the historic Camlann versus Free Worlds ruling as precedent, barring entry to all high-ranking Free Worlds League representatives and breaking away from the League.
ReputationStatements: I don't know why we bother offering you contracts, to be perfectly honest. It's obvious you're not a friend to the Rim Commonality. Regardless, we find ourselves in desperate times, so we have to scrape the bottom of the barrel.
Greetings, mercenary. Lowly and despicable though you may be, you may yet serve our interests. Finish this job, and we may look upon you with more favor than you likely deserve.
The Rim Commonality has a use for mercenaries like you, Commander. I think you'll be interested in the attached contract. Hopefully we can come to a mutually beneficial agreement.
The Rim Commonality would like to offer you a choice contract, Commander. As the leader of a respected mercenary company, you should find the terms both fair and equitable, I think.
Commander, I hope this message finds you well. The people of the Rim Commonality would like to extend a contract to you, owing to our respect for your skills. Please consider it carefully.

Greetings, my friend. This contract is not one we would offer to a lesser mercenary, but you've proven your loyalty, prowess, and dedication to the ideals of the Rim Commonality. I hope you'll accept our offer.

We both know the score, Commander. The Commonality relies on you like you're one of our own, and you've always been happy to help us out. I hope you can see fit to agree this time as well—this is a job too important for lesser warriors.
MissionSuccessStatements: Top-tier work, Commander—The Commonality is very happy with your performance. Keep it up, and I'll make sure a lot more work comes your way.
GoodFaithFailureStatements: The Rim Commonality understands that sacrifice on the battlefield doesn't always translate to victory. You've made a fine effort, even if it failed. Just another lesson for the next battle.
BadFaithFailureStatements: We are deeply disappointed in your performance, Commander. Your efforts on the battlefield were those of a raw cadet, not the leader of a mercenary company.
